backend/main.mo: Motoko canister that checks question text against various keyword patterns and returns predefined responses.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report linking the new positive/thankâ€‘you example prompt to affected frontend components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of several frontend files describing their roles in the chat UI, styling, config, and utilities.
frontend/.env.example: Example environment file showing how to set the deployment URL variable.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles and custom OKLCH color variables defining warm-toned light and dark themes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point setting the AI Logic title, favicon, and loading the main React script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main chat UI component handling messages, API calls, example prompts, and rendering the header and layout.
frontend/src/components/AppLinkSection.t: Component that shows the deployment URL and includes a copy-to-clipboard button.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and manages the backend actor, updating when the user's identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Context and provider for managing Internet Identity login, stored identities, and authentication state.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query mutation hook invoking the backend answerQuestion method and invalidating related queries.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base layers and OKLCH color variables for light and dark themes plus global body styles.
frontend/src/lib/deployConfig.ts: Exports the deployment URL from environment variables for use in the UI.
frontend/src/lib/domainValidation.ts: Provides utilities to normalize domain strings and validate them against length and character rules.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and the Internet Identity provider.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom colors, typography, container settings, animations, and extended theme values.
project_state.json: Stores project metadata, existing features, and pending feature requests for positive word recognition.
